value.title: DAX Fridays #208: Open orders in DAX | Events in progress & Time intelligence
value.excerpt: In today's video, we are going to go through how to think about Time Intelligence calculations with a specific case: Calculating the number of open orders using DAX. value.title: DAX Fridays! #21: USERELATIONSHIP
value.excerpt: A common example in a Power BI table is to have multiple dates, which are related to the same Date table. As you are limited to one active relationship, we need to use the DAX function USERELATIONSHIP to manage the inactive relationships. value.title: Combining Tables in Power BI   Union Except and Intersect in DAX
value.excerpt: Power Query is often the engine used for combining data tables, especially using Merge or Append. However, sometimes, you might need to do that operation in DAX. An example of that is when you want to create that combination only virtually as part of a measure calculation that evaluates dynamically.

value.title: ConcatenateX in Power BI and DAX   Concatenate Values of a Column
